The Director, SRT Does This By



The position of Director, Supplier Relationship Team (SRT), is a critical role in leading and managing the operations with Contract Development and Manufacturing Organizations (CDMOs) for supply of our marketed products and future innovations.


Provide Category Leadership for the portfolio of CDMOs and CMOs aligned with the business to strategically manage and prioritize business objectives for the Brands in conjunction with the Strategic Resource Allocation model. Where required, collaborate with SRT Lead for CDMOs/CMOs external to the Director’s portfolio to represent/coordinate supply priorities aligned with the Category business needs.

Be the principal point of contact for the business relationship for specific CDMOSs and CMOs. For CDMOs/CMOs within the Director, Strategic Relationship Management Team’s portfolio work closely with SRT Lead assigned to lead the specific CDMO / CMO.

Lead a cross-functional team to ensure end-to-end oversight of assigned CDMOs and CMOs, ensuring reliable on-going supply, quality, customer service, compliance, value and innovation for the life cycle of the contract (from selection of the supplier, technology transfer activities and management of commercial packaging activities) and across the life cycle of the product portfolio with the CMOs.

Develop beneficial relationships with the assigned contract manufacturers in order to deliver increased competitive advantage through managed cost, customer service, agility & quality within the framework of the Manufacturing Supply Agreements (MSA) and Quality Assurance Agreements (QAA) with these CDMOs and CMOs.

Work closely with the Regional CMO Leadership Team to continuously evaluate the CDMO and CMO base and ensure that the right partners exist with the appropriate capabilities.


The Director, Supplier Relationship Team must be a highly experienced and skilled person with the ability to work cross-functionally within GSK and externally with the CDMO/CMO. The role requires leadership to deliver against the business objectives and aspirations with the appropriate application of quality and compliance to protect GSK and their customers.


Supplier Relationship Team Management



Provide Category portfolio representation for Supply Chain related to products and capabilities sourced from CDMOs/CMOs. Ensure alignment on business requirements through Integrated Business Planning process and support for Brand Innovation.

Lead and manage cross-functional team of 4-6 functional team members per CDMO/CMO to manage supply of products from Contract Development and Manufacturing Organizations.

Build communication channels and governance structure for supplier relationships.

Drive adherence and maintenance to the MSA, QAA and SLA agreements with suppliers, rigorously follow the designed operating rhythm, with periodic KPI review and continuous improvement initiatives as per the applicable contracts/ agreements

Work with Supplier Relationship teams to enable optimum supply chain set-up to deliver end to end supply chain performance across costs, quality, service and agility. Ensure alignment on supplier strategies, negotiations and changes with functional heads and subject matter experts in the wider CMO community.

Lead the Supply Chain for all product life cycle events ranging from new product introductions, portfolio extensions/rationalization, technical transfers and pruning/ divestment, etc.

Drive continuous improvement, cost savings ideation, cost avoidance, and delivery. Includes sourcing consolidation opportunities to drive supply chain efficiency and improvements.

Indirectly work with SRMs providing SRT leadership for CDMOs/CMOs supporting the Category assigned. Where required supervise a team of Supplier Relationship Managers (SRMs) in terms of capability and process development. 



Supply Chain Strategy



Support development of CMO Network strategy within the SRT with key inputs on managing supplier performance and capability to deliver on cost, service, quality and agility across CMO Network.

Identify and select suitable CMOs and Business Partners with the appropriate capabilities which are in line with business expectations, objectives and compliance requirements to enable the right sourcing decisions.



Compliance & Risk Mitigation



Responsible for ensuring a fully compliant value chain (local as well as corporate rules & guidelines): Quality Assurance elements such as GMPs, EH&S, Financial and regulatory compliance.

Responsible for proactive risk identification and mitigation planning to protect business requirements.






Why you?







Basic Qualifications



We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:


Bachelor’s degree in Technical or Business Degree in Site Manufacturing Operations; Contract Manufacturing Operations; Procurement 




10-12 Years’ Experience In The Following Areas




Experience of supply chain and logistics leadership including development and implementation of supply chains either internally or externally

Experience of supplier performance and relationship management across complex supply chains

Experience in Procurement and Relationship Management with external business partners / CMOs.

Experience implementing new product launches and the integration of new businesses and business models

People and capability development experience.




Preferred Qualifications



If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:


Strong knowledge across Supply Chain Operations (Supply Chain Planning, Plant Operations, Quality, Technical, etc.) and Product Lifecycle Management.

Supply chain strategy skills including supplier relationship management, supplier development, continuous improvement Excellent Sourcing and Procurement skills with a proven track record of achievements 

Knowledge of EHS, cGMP & Regulatory requirements, Financial P&L's and business case architecture, Logistics and Supply planning, business case for Contract Manufacturing sites.

Strong interpersonal skills and ability to influence a complex and diverse matrix of stakeholders and peers across regional and categories. The gravitas to operate at a senior management level within a multi-national blue-chip organization.

An ability to build and maintain effective working relationships across the Commercial, R&D and Supply Chain organizations.

Demonstrated problem solving abilities suitable for handling the highly complex issues associated with technical and supply problems.

The ability to prioritize and work with multiple projects and tasks concurrently.

Ability to challenge status quo and existing practices and to introduce new ideas and change ways of working based on sound understanding of product details and the related manufacturing process

Knowledge of Risk analysis and option analysis tools and techniques

The ability to lead cross functional teams to an aligned strategic vision for CH QSC and GSK.





Why Consumer Healthcare?

 


Right now, we’re on an incredible journey as we prepare to become the first independent, 100% focused consumer healthcare company. We’re doing this at a time when the work we do has never mattered more. Better everyday health is about improving the health and wellness of the consumers that we touch every year – over a billion and a half of them – and it goes beyond products. It’s about truly helping people manage their health proactively in different ways as consumer needs evolve.

With category leading brands such as Sensodyne, Voltaren and Centrum, built on trusted science and human understanding, and combined with our passion, knowledge and expertise, we’re uniquely placed to do this and to grow a strong, successful business.

This is an exciting time to join us and help shape the future. It’s an opportunity to be part of something special.


Diversity, Equity and Inclusion 


In Consumer Healthcare we embrace our diverse workforce by creating an inclusive environment that celebrates our unique perspectives, generates curiosity to create unmatched understanding of each other, and promotes fair and equitable outcomes for everyone.

We’re striving to create a climate where we celebrate our diversity in all forms by treating each other with respect, listening to different viewpoints, supporting our communities, and creating a workplace where your authentic self belongs and thrives.

The Regional Director, Supervision is accountable to ensure that the region meets all of its compliance supervision requirements as the designee for regulatory supervision of all its registrants in the region. This role is also accountable to provide advice and guidance to registrants regarding applicable policies, processes and other key execution activities in conjunction with the Market Leaders (matrix) within the region.


The Regional Director, Supervision will provide strategic supervision leadership support to the whole region and /or to a designated group of branches depending on the needs of the region and reports into the National Director Supervision.

By ensuring strong execution of supervision activities in the region, the Regional Director, Supervision assists in enhancing the adherence to compliance with the policies and procedures & strategic initiatives of the Firm. 

Accountable to execute the Firm’s direction on key supervision matters including regional business planning, communications/presentations, training and change management to achieve overall regulatory objectives 



The Regional Director, Supervision supports the business/group leader in the effective implementation, maintenance and administration of first line of defence programs (e.g., operational risk, AML, compliance, regulatory, etc.), including overseeing business operations within the jurisdiction to ensure adherence and efficiency. Contributes to a strong risk management culture through collaboration with other first line employees, and second & third line functions to ensure Compliance, AML or operational risks are identified, mitigated, monitored and reported on an ongoing basis.


Manages people and leads a team capable of delivering the desired business results.

Makes recommendations to senior leaders on strategy and new initiatives, based on an in-depth understanding of the business/group.

Acts as a subject matter expert on relevant regulations and policies.

Acts as a strategic partner in which the program elements becomes an integrated component of the overall business/group strategies and helps drive business impact.

Prepares and briefs senior leaders on regulatory matters across multiple businesses/groups.

Supports multiple, similar business units with moderate complexity & business transaction risk.

Represents the business/group on Governance/Risk Working Groups/Forums and provides regular updates.

Monitors and advises on management of risk requirements within the defined risk appetite.

Manages/supports large/complex risk programs/frameworks /projects/initiatives to ensure risks are appropriately mitigated and regulations adhered to.

Monitors industry and legislative developments and continuously updates programs to ensure they are competitive and effective.

Supports the position on regulatory compliance issues by interpreting requirements (existing, new and emerging) and identifying, analysing and addressing resultant gaps and issues, including those raised through the review of change initiatives. Understands the identified risk exposures and supports the development of action plans required to mitigate identified risks.

Acts as a subject matter expert in the evaluation, development and implementation of an internal control system.

May network with industry contacts to gain competitive insights and best practices.

Recommends business priorities, advises on resource requirements and develops roadmap for strategic execution.

Manages resources and leads the execution of strategic initiatives to deliver on business and financial goals.

Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.

Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.

Ensures alignment between stakeholders.

Acts as the prime subject matter expert for internal/external stakeholders.

Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide insights and recommendations.

Monitors and tracks performance, and addresses any issues.

Leads change management programs of varying scope and type, including readiness assessments, planning, stakeholder management, execution, evaluation and sustainment of initiatives.

Leads the execution of operational programs; assesses and adapts as needed to ensure quality of execution.

Monitoring to ensure that 1st line jobs are following defined processes and procedures.

Develops, documents and maintains business/group procedures updating and obtaining approvals as regulations or the operating environment changes and communicates changes to the business/group & relevant stakeholder groups.

Designs measurable sustainment strategies including assessing and recommending mitigations for industry/ segment-specific risks and prioritizing opportunities presented by internal and external stakeholders.

Tracks exception/exemption requests and corresponding approvals.

Facilitates training to ensure business unit employees fully understand requirements.

Provides quality control for investigations, self-reports, examinations and independent reviews conducted by internal and external stakeholders, including regulators, providing verbal and written responses to requests for positions, action plans, information and/or documentation

Builds awareness, knowledge, and skills and, as necessary, provides communication, practical tools and ongoing support including making presentations, to promote a culture of risk identification and management.

Supports the management of 1st Line Of Defence program for the business/group in compliance with appropriate principles, standards & direction from the second line of defense groups. Includes developing and promoting program and ensuring the execution of all program components.

Works with assigned business/group leaders to implement 1st Line Of Defence programs and frameworks, developing and maintaining an in-depth understanding of the applicable regulatory and internal risk management requirements. Interprets and provides advice on the application of the requirements for the business/group.

Develops and maintains an understanding of the business/group strategies and objectives, products and services, internal and external stakeholders and business processes as well as the underlying infrastructure to identify and manage implications and risk exposures for the business/group.

Identifies, investigates, analyzes, documents & mitigates program risks, taking into account jurisdictional issues, and raises any issues or concerns to senior leaders and other stakeholders.

Analyzes the impact and effectiveness of the program through periodic reviews.

Recommends adjustments to the overall program, policy or processes within the business/group in accordance with the Risk Appetite Statement, Governance and Corporate Policy.

Supports the business/group through internal/external audits or regulatory examinations and assists in development of action plans to resolve any identified issues.

Provides support to the development and delivery of training and awareness programs within the business/group to increase awareness of and compliance to risk management requirements.

Operates at a group/enterprise-wide level and serves as a specialist resource to senior leaders and stakeholders.

Applies expertise and thinks creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine.

Implements changes in response to shifting trends.

Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.




Knowledge



QUALIFICATIONS: 



University degree or equivalent

CSC and CPH

IIROC Branch Manager proficiency (Branch Supervision Course) and registration required

Options Supervisor proficiency and registration required

US Securities proficiency (Series 7,24 & SIE)

At least 7-10 years of experience in a senior compliance/ trade supervision role in an IIROC regulated Firm




Skills



Proven ability to understand regulatory, legal and risk concepts and execute Firm’s policies and procedures per business requirements.

Strong organizational and professional leadership skills and the ability to effectively organize a process with high visibility and multiple deliverables with specific and time sensitive deadlines

Strong knowledge of the Canadian financial services and business operations.

Bilingualism (French/English) 

Post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Program Management skills - Expert.

Seasoned professional with a combination of education, experience and industry knowledge.

Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth / Expert.

Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth / Expert.

Influence skills - In-depth / Expert.

Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration - In-depth / Expert.

Able to manage ambiguity.

Data driven decision making - In-depth / Expert.




We’re here to help


At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en.

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

industries: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice .

We are currently seeking a 
Director, Data Insights
 to join our
 Business Operations team
.


What your team does:


The Data Insights Director together with their team has a unique opportunity right now to scale Data Insights to the next level in terms of scale, scope, and sophistication in a rapidly growing legal tech unicorn. This includes defining the team’s long-term capabilities and capacity roadmap. Consisting of intelligent, hard-working Data Scientists and Data Analysts, our team isn't just about solving business problems—they participate in defining what challenges and opportunities we want to spearhead next that impact Clio’s short-term and long-term strategies.

In addition to scaling in a high-growth environment where your work is tied to the most critical components of Clio’s business strategy, your team also tackles newer business opportunities. Opportunities such as legal tech acquisitions ( Lawyaw and CalendarRules ), our payments platform and new funding rounds —all of which further deepen Clio’s ability to understand our customers and the practice of law.

Your Data Insights team helps us to define company strategy within a workplace culture that embraces data and even celebrates it with the annual Legal Trends Report read by tens of thousands of legal professionals globally every year.


Who you are:


As a Director of Data Insights, you will be a thought leader and directly contribute to our mission of ‘Transforming the Legal Experience for All”. You will be the most senior data and analytics leader in the company and have a very active and crucial role in providing inputs into key strategic decisions and strategic planning activities.


What you’ll work on:
 

 Building and scaling a world-class Data Insights Team. 

 Leading the strategic direction of the Data Insights team.


 Proactively identify research priorities for the team that are aligned to Clio’s short-term and long-term strategies as well as the alleviation of business challenges. 

 Design a unified research roadmap for the team (aligning to our annual strategic planning activities). 

 Identify BI project priorities (including standardized reporting across the organization - quarterly and annually) for the team that can deliver on Clio’s short-term and long-term strategies and other business priorities. 

 Oversee the standardization and optimization of Looker. 


 Serving as a strategic partner for senior leaders/executives:


 Share insights developed by your team to inform strategic decision-making regarding:


 Product innovation 

 Go-to-market strategy 

 International strategy 

 Brand and marketing strategy, including thought leadership 

 Revenue strategy 

 M & A 

 Customer Success 



 Intentionally driving a scientific culture throughout the organization, including driving the democratization of data. 

 Collaborating with leaders in our data engineering and qualitative research teams to develop a unified data infrastructure and research roadmap. 

 Providing enablement across the company that allows teams and individuals to conduct their own research and design experiments. 




What you may have:



 At least 8 years managing a strategic research or analytics team and projects. 

 At least 5 years experience working in data science, analytics, or statistics research. 

 A strong skill set in strategy, partnerships, stakeholder management, and change leadership. 

 Extensive data management and infrastructure experience. 

 Excellent facilitation, written and verbal communication skills. 

 Strong project management, organizational skills, and business acumen. 

 An ability to move with speed and urgency without sacrificing quality. 




Serious bonus points if you have:



 Experience conducting research or analytics regarding the legal profession 

 SaaS Experience 




Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 


Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion . We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers


About Clio


At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.

We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Canada’s Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies . In line with our mission, we’ve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative , and most recently, securing a US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com



Job Description




What You’ll Be Doing


The Director, Application Development will partner with business stakeholders, technology leadership, enterprise architecture, operations and development teams to drive the development of end-end-to solutions. You will develop application roadmaps, own delivery and provide technical leadership to key strategic and transformative programs related to Cards Technology.

We are looking for high-energy individuals with an entrepreneurial spirit, who are focused on the challenge of building the bank of the future. You will be accountable for leading a team that is focused on modernizing and migrating legacy applications to cloud. This will involve leading complex projects from design to implementation, aligned to CIBC’s enterprise architecture roadmap in building the best in class solutions ,adhering to CIBC high standards and quality of technical work.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. To successfully perform the work, details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.



How You’ll Succeed




 Strong Leadership : Be a bold and authentic leader who is passionate about developing and coaching to bring out the best in people. Direct, motivate, develop and manage performance of the project delivery teams. 

 Strategic Development & Execution: Build technical solutions that take into account enterprise vision, current state and opportunities to build future state platforms. Analyze the viability of the solution to meet timelines, budget and quality. 

 Relationship Management: Partner with team across CIBC to develop the technology roadmap. Collaborate with Business and Technology partners to translate requirements to technical designs and act as the lead technical authority. 

 Collaborative : Work with Business Stakeholders, Architecture, Technology, and Product teams to ensure all aspects of the solution are defined in conjunction with CIBC standards, policies, priorities and best practices. 

 Strong Communication: Working closely and interacting with business partners and vendors reporting, negotiating and managing services, documenting and presenting ideas and recommendations. 




Who You Are




 You can demonstrate experience and maturity in building and managing large scale implementations. You have 8+ years of years of architecture, delivery experience implementing solutions on large projects with solid understanding on data, security, resilient systems design, integrations, microservices and application development via project implementations. Experience on large scale cloud transformation initiatives is preferred. Experience with Pega based applications will be an added asset especially products/frameworks like Smart Dispute, DSM/CDH. 

 You're driven to succeed. You are motivated by accomplishing your goals and delivering your best to make an impact. 

 You're driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life. 

 You're digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends. 

 You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don't. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making. 

 You look beyond the moment. make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what's possible. 

 Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability. 




What CIBC Offers



Joining CIBC means becoming part of a team that is empowered and encouraged to act like owners, and to do the right thing for the client, every time. We’re a diverse community, operating in an environment that acknowledges our employees’ unique talents, contributions and accomplishments.


Thrive in a world of flexibility and enablement

Connect as a diverse team and make innovation happen

Develop through ongoing learning and growth: collaboration, exposure, mentorship, and exceptional training opportunities

Prosper through our collective success: Competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefit program, and employee share purchase plan




What You Need To Know




 CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com 

 You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit 

 CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation. 



Job Location


Toronto-81 Bay, 16th Floor


Employment Type


Regular


Weekly Hours


37.5

description:
Bilingual Tour Director Manager



EF Educational Tours Canada



Montreal, QC (Hybrid work setup - opportunity to work from home 2 days a week)



Start Date: Immediate Start






The Role



As Tour Director Manager you will work closely with the operations team in the Montreal and Toronto offices in the recruitment, management and retention of Tour Directors to lead our travellers on their tours.

Tour Directors are on-site experts responsible for leading student and adult tour groups across Canada.You will oversee our communication with them and ensure they have the necessary tools to conduct their tours flawlessly. Your job is to match the right Tour Director with the right group. In this role, you will be involved in everything from recruiting our talent, training, internal and external communications, and making great allocations.

To be successful in this role, you will rely on your interpersonal and recruitment skills coupled with your strategic planning skills in the understanding of staffing needs to coincide with the training and retainment of exceptional tour directors.



Key Requirements




Bachelor’s Degree

1-2 years of work experience, preferably in a travel, educational or hospitality field

Exceptionally strong communicator: clear, persuasive, motivating and trustworthy

Bilingual - French & English

Travel experience is an asset with strong familiarity with the province of Quebec

Positive attitude - you think nothing is impossible

Ability to build strong relationships externally and internally

Excellent time management and organizational skills with ability to meet deadlines

Driven team player with a strong work ethic

Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Office suite including: Excel, Word, PowerPoint & Outlook

Familiarity with website design is a plus


What you'll Do:



Work closely with our Operations team in Toronto and Montreal to source, hire and manage Tour Directors

Match our Tour Directors with the appropriate student groups 

Be involved in everything from recruiting, training, external communications to allocations, debriefing, and retaining Canadian Tour Directors.

Oversee Tour Director's communication and tools (Onboarding app, TD website)




Why You’ll Love Working Here



Work in our light-filled office where you’ll enjoy comprehensive professional development, frequent social programming, office-wide sports leagues, and employee-run social groups (including our “EFinity” groups: Black@EF, LGBTQ+@EF, Indigenous@EF, API@EF, and Parents@EF). And did we mention the free coffee, beer, and snacks?! You can also expect:


Paid international travel 

Robust professional growth opportunities including monthly trainings, workshops, and inspiring talks with global leaders and experts

Three weeks paid vacation your first year (four weeks starting in year two) and nine paid holidays

20% company match on your RRSP (25% after 5-years)

Excellent health, dental, and vision coverage, along with life and disability insurance

Wellness benefits including $500 yearly fitness reimbursement

EF program discounts including travel, language schools, childcare, and more

Discounts at local venues and businesses

Eligibility for our Workplace Flexibility Program: our pilot hybrid work model with up to two days of remote work per week.




A Little Bit About EF Education First



At EF we believe that the world is better when people try to understand one another. Since 1965, we have helped millions of people see new places, experience new cultures, and learn new things about the world and about themselves. Our culturally immersive education programs—focused on language, travel, cultural exchange, and academics—turn dreams into international opportunities. When you join EF, you join a multicultural and diverse community working across 600 schools and offices in 50 countries, all with one shared mission of opening the world through education.

Whoever you are, whatever you are passionate about—we welcome you and want you to bring that to work every day. EF is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and belonging across race, ethnicity, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, age, religion, ability, parental status,experience and everything else that makes you unique.

Founded in Sweden in 1965, EF has schools and offices around the world, including hubs in Boston, London, Mexico City, São Paulo, Shanghai, Stockholm, Zürich, and more. Learn more at https://ef.com.

description:
Our client, a leader in the healthcare space, is seeking a Senior Director of IT and Security Operations to join their IT leadership team. This role will oversee a security operations team and provide strategic planning, system monitoring and performance reporting. This role is also responsible for working closely with security vendors to improve and enhance the organizations security posture. 

 


RESPONSIBILITIES:


 

-Oversee IT security operations team, providing mentorship and guidance 

-Assist business in understanding and responding to security audits and failures 

-Manage and coordinate operational components of incident management, including detection, response, and reporting.

-Manage security projects at a portfolio level and provide expert guidance on security matters 

- Work as a liaison with vendors to establish mutually acceptable contracts and service-level agreements.

-Coordinate, measure, and report on the technical aspects of security management.

-Work with security team to manage production issues and incidents and participate in problem and change management forums.

- Oversee budgets and P&L of division. 

-Ensure all audit trails, system logs and other monitoring data sources at the business unit level are reviewed on a scheduled basis and are compliant with policies and audit requirements.

-Provide support and guidance for legal and regulatory compliance efforts, including audit support.

-Manage outsourced vendors that provide information security functions for compliance with contracted service-level agreements.

-Assist in the onboarding of newly acquired applications and hardware to ensure compliance with security policies and architecture. 

 

 


REQUIREMENTS:


 

- Current security certifications, including CISSP, CISA or CISM are desired 

-10+ years information technology experience

- Extensive experience managing an IT security team

- Extensive experience building security policy 

-Preferred experience working in the healthcare sector is an asset 

 

If you are interested in this role and meet the core requirements please email your resume michael.rattner@quantum.ca

As Director, CRM/CX (Software Insights Team) you create and deliver client-driven, project-based, practical research and advisory services that helps Info-Tech Members drive measurable results in their organizations. You’ll help organizations pick the right technology and improve their operations, with your primary focus being in the domain of Customer Experience (CX) technology, including systems such as Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platforms, e-commerce solutions, digital marketing toolsets and customer service systems.

In this role, you will act as Info-Tech’s subject matter expert on technology to effectively manage sales, marketing, and customer service processes. You will also be a thought leader in this space, identifying trends that are dominating the industry, and how organizations should best leverage customer experience platforms to drive gains in their businesses.






What you will do, includes, but not limited to:




Research



Build strong relationships with leading technology vendors to understand trends and compare product performance.

Participate in briefings and conferences with CX technology providers and provide feedback on tool performance and market fit.

Build critical points-of-view on CX technology trends, value drivers, and technology providers.

Create high-impact research, tools and templates that equip our members with actionable strategies for adopting and succeeding with customer experience technology.

Produce provocative thought leadership content, in the form of short form notes, and longer form industry briefs, on CX technology trends and best practices.

Keep a pulse on what’s happening in the industry around your areas of expertise including upcoming trends and best practices, in part, to assist in your contribution of ideas to the research agenda



 Client Advisory Services



Deliver great advisory experiences via client calls and workshops; advise Info-Tech IT members on customer experience technology trends, strategies, and tools.

Help our members make great selection and implementation decisions around key sales, marketing and customer service technologies like CRM platforms and digital marketing tools.

Assist to scope member concerns and direct them to relevant research as well as identify gaps in research products.



Cross-Departmental Collaboration & Support



Provide subject matter expertise to Sales, Workshop Delivery, Consulting, Public Relations & Marketing teams as needed.

Leverage SoftwareReviews data and reports to provide insights into vendor performance, competitive positioning, and client relationship qualities in their respective software categories.

Education and Experience



Undergraduate degree required (business or technology preferred). An MA, MBA, or MSc beneficial.

IT certifications as well as management consulting or project management certifications are considered beneficial.

Practical experience (10+ years) working in a customer experience technology role, with preference given to analyst experience, consulting, or product management. Experience with software categories considered to be of benefit include:

Customer Relationship Management Platforms

Digital Marketing toolsets (i.e. e-mail marketing or social media management platforms)

Web Content Management Systems

Job Title

Analytical Suite Director

Department

Research Portfolio | Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences

Compensation Range

5,906.25 - $8,508.42 CAD Monthly

Posting End Date

March 15, 2022

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.


Job End Date



This position is expected to be filled by promotion/reassignment and is included here to inform you of its vacancy at the University.




Job Summary



The Analytical Suite Director is responsible for the overall operation of the Pharmaceutical Sciences Analytical Suite, including LC-MS/MS systems, NMR, confocal microscope, and ultrasound imaging instrument. Responsible for strategic planning, operations, safety and training, as well as developing and implementing new methods.


Organizational Status


This position is self-directed, but reports to the Associate Dean of Research. Supervises Research Associates in the use of the Suite’s instrumentation, and works closely with Pharmaceutical Sciences faculty, staff, postdoctoral research fellows, students and external stakeholders.


Work Performed




Responsibilities Include The Following




Provides leadership in the operational readiness and advancement of the Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences Analytical Suite.

Responsible for the services that the Analytical Suite provides to the research community, both internal and external to UBC.

Develops and manages annual budgets and performs periodic cost and productivity analyses. Prepares funding proposals, including contributing to CFI capital equipment grant requests.

Responsible for setting pricing and initiating invoicing for analytical services provided to members. Keeps detailed records of all service and provides ongoing communication on work status and billing of laboratories.

Responsible for the selection of all minor research equipment and supplies. Advises Associate Dean Research and Equipment Committee on the purchases of all major scientific equipment for the Faculty.

Establishes preventative maintenance programs for all equipment and instruments within the Analytical Suite.

Provides leadership in the mass spectrometry system diagnosis and oversees the repair in all associated instruments (includes the mechanics, electronics and software of mass spectrometry instruments, as well as servicing of HPLC instrumentation, spotters and autoloaders).

Responsible for the comprehensive safety of the Analytical Suite, ensuring appropriate training and safety compliance with internal Faculty policies, UBC Safety and Risk Services, WHMIS, WorkSafe BC policies and federal, provincial and municipal regulations.

Plans and develops training programs and instruction for research staff, graduate students, undergraduate students, and faculty members regarding scientific instrument operation. May negotiate training programs with vendors.

Consults with and advises research groups within the Faculty and at UBC, on analytical techniques.

Advancing new technologies. Develops new analytical techniques and conducts research on new instrumentation and methodologies in mass spectrometry and related areas.

Designs and implements modifications on existing instrumentation and techniques in to accommodate the analytical needs of research groups. Often this requires customized instrumental and/or procedural developments.

Liaise with agencies, vendors, and suppliers regarding the instrumentation and operation thereof.

Establishes and furthers the contact between the Faculty and manufacturers of scientific equipment. Acts as a liaison between the Faculty and all current and prospective clients from UBC and off campus.

Required to keep current in the fields of mass spectrometry, chromatography, confocal microscopy, nuclear magnetic resonance, ultrasound imaging, related computer facilities and associated areas by following scientific literature, attending conferences and manufacturers' meetings. This cutting-edge knowledge is required to plan future expansion of analytical capabilities and equipment needs for the Faculty to ensure ongoing support of research projects.



Consequence of Error/Judgement


A wide range of academic research groups rely on the analytical data generated in the Analytical Suite. Errors in leadership and in ensuring the instruments are in the operational state of readiness and advancement may result in delays to research, damage to scientific instruments, high expenditures to correct instrument failures, and have consequences on human health and safety.


Supervision Received


The position is self-directed.


Supervision Given


Directly supervises and manages two Faculty Research Associates in the routine maintenance, use and operation of autoclaves and sterilizers and ultracentrifuges. Provides training and supervision to faculty, staff, graduate students, undergraduate students, postdoctoral fellows, research associates, visiting scientists, Work Learn students, and summer students in related areas of expertise. May hire students under programs such as Work Study.



Minimum Qualifications



For research work, a post-graduate degree or equivalent professional designation with a minimum of four years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Otherwise, an undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline is required with a minimum of six years of related experience, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.



Preferred Qualifications



Preference will be given to those with experience in analytical chemistry or MSc in Chemistry or Physics, and to an applicant with industrial (non-academic) laboratory experience including supervision of technicians or trainees. Extensive practical and theoretical knowledge of the mass spectrometric techniques, procedures, and practices. Detailed knowledge of chromatographic techniques and general analytical chemistry. Detailed knowledge of confocal microscopy and NMR including instrumentation maintenance and support. Ability to work independently on performing analyses for the characterization of various synthetic compounds or natural products and cell-based imaging. Ability to manage Research Associates and technicians. Ability to work effectively with Finance staff for invoicing and billing. Ability to instruct and communicate effectively with faculty, staff and students in explaining the analytical procedures. Ability to schedule workload to meet departmental requirements.

Edmonton, Alberta

The Sisters of Providence are a religious order of women established in Montreal Quebec in 1843, and first came to Western Canada in 1886. With a mission to “meet the needs that were not being met by others” the Sisters of Providence provide services in areas that are not reached by normal businesses.   Our ministries are diverse and fulfilling, including (but not limited to) ministering to the sick in hospitals, nursing homes, spiritual ministries and retreats. We continue to minister to the indigenous people, ethnic groups, sponsor refugee families, help with food banks, and provide safe interim housing for abused women and children.

We cannot do our work without people like YOU who desire to share the mission and to make a real difference in the lives of others in our community.  For more information on who we are and what we do, please check out our website at https://www.sistersofprovidence.ca/  


What you will do:


Working with the Sisters of Providence as Director of Finance you will be a member of the Provincial Leadership Team. You will provide professional expertise related to accounting, financial, administrative, and legal operations for the purpose of ensuring adequate financial management for our many charitable works. In partnership with the Provincial Treasurer of the Sisters of Providence you will assist the Sisters with all things financial. You will have a diverse and challenging financial portfolio, including (but not limited to) the supervision and analysis of full cycle accounting, monitoring all assets, both financial and capital, financial reporting, budgeting, and analysis, long-term and short-term planning, maintaining the chart of accounts, preparing and monitoring service agreements, review and reconciliation of financial statements, filing the various returns, planning and participating in the required audits, monitoring employee benefits programs, and assisting and advising the Sisters of Providence in financial matters. 





Qualifications and Skills: 


·              Degree in finance or equivalent experience.

·              Chartered Professional Accountant (CPA) designation preferred.

·              Canadian accounting experience in the charitable sector.

·              Experience in a faith-based organization is an asset.

 

In accordance with Alberta Health and Wellness Accommodation Standards all employees will have an Alberta vulnerable persons record search conducted prior to employment and are required to receive all Alberta Health Services recommended vaccines, including the annual influenza and COVID 19 vaccine(s).

Our client, a leading independent full-service financial services firm, with operations in wealth management and capital markets is looking to hire an Advisor Marketing Lead (Director) to join their team.





Your New Company


Our client is a leading independent full-service financial services firm, with operations in wealth management and capital markets. They are the #1 independent wealth management firm in Canada and are the leading mid-market provider of investment banking advisory, equity research, sales and trading services for corporations and institutions. They pride themselves on understanding their clients’ needs and finding innovative, bespoke solutions to meet their goals.




Their culture is dynamic and unique in the financial services space. They are a lean, entrepreneurial, and collaborative which fosters a meritocratic environment where everyone has a voice. Their teams operate in a fast-paced, agile environment which allows everyone to have direct impact on the business. They attract creative thinkers who love constantly rethinking how to elevate the status quo.





Your New Role


We are looking for a collaborative, organised and entrepreneurial candidate with strong relationship management experience to help the Wealth Management Advisors grow their practices. This role will report directly to the Head of Marketing in Canada and is responsible for all Advisor marketing. To accomplish this, you will partner with Advisors to understand their growth objectives, and work with internal and external teams to help bring these objectives to life through digital media, social content, email and website marketing.





Responsibilities



Relationship lead with all Wealth Advisors/ teams;

Support top Advisors in planning and executing on their own digital/ social media investment of to drive client lead generation;

Collaborate with internal wealth planning and financial markets experts to inform ongoing social creative that can form Advisor content calendars;

Support Advisors in leveraging Salesforce to nurture existing client relationships through email marketing/ journey builder;

Ownership of all Advisor marketing approvals, specifically ensuring they abide by the brand guidelines;

Relationship lead with any creative and media partners (either internal or external) related to Advisor communications;

Management of team of 5 direct reports






What You’ll Need to Succeed



7-10 years’ experience in marketing with a focus on client management

Specific experience leading and executing digital and social content and media plans

Deep understanding and passion for communications and problem solving

Ability to ‘get stuff done’ with a hands-on approach; there is no job too big or too small

Highly collaborative, with experience managing a team- either direct team and/or cross functional teams

Thrives in entrepreneurial, fast paced environment

Organized with excellent time-management and project management skills

Excellent communication skills (verbal, written and visual)

Bachelor’s degree, or College Diploma in Design / Fine Arts or related field






What You’ll get in Return


As the Advisor Marketing Lead (Director), you will receive a total compensation of up to $150,000 + comprehensive benefits which start from your first day alongside 2-3 weeks of vacation.

Intel com
 is a fast-growing Canadian company in the e-commerce delivery sector. Our teams across the country and our network of delivery partners contribute to the success of our day-to-day activities. Our goal is simple: in a constantly evolving business sector, we do not just follow. We are getting ahead and we stand out with innovative delivery services and methods. 




Intelcom is a company committed to the continuous improvement and optimization of its services to its employees, partners and customers. Operations Supervisors are key employees who ensure the seamless running of our delivery business. We are presently looking for a full-time Operations Supervisor to support our growth!





Responsibilities:



Having an excellent sense of communication: Coordinating and managing business partners, allocating routes already optimized/distributed to drivers.

Being organized: Managing undelivered packages and warehouse returns and completing a daily report at the end of the shift. Participating in the development of procedures and working methods in collaboration with the Director of Operations and monitoring KPIs (Key performance indicator).

Being resourceful and autonomous: Real time monitoring of the deliveries made by business partners and, if necessary, intervening by finding solutions to meet the objectives of the company.

Knowing how to manage stress: Work in an environment where deadlines are very short and able to adapt very quickly to the needs of the business. Ability to make quick decisions and problem solving skills to ensure the smooth running of the Station/Delivery Center.

Being vigilant in ensuring the use of safe work methods and behaviours within your team.



Recruitment: 



At least 2 years in an operations supervisory role, preferably in the transport industry.

Know the current occupational health and safety regulations in force.

Have general computer knowledge (Office365).

Have knowledge of current transport laws and regulations.

Be able to express yourself in English.






If this job interests you, send us your application and we’ll get in touch with you as soon as possible.

Flipp is a retail technology company that is reinventing the way people shop. We work with the largest retailers and manufacturers in the world to help them transform their business and connect them with tens of millions of shoppers through the next generation digital shopping marketplace.




Our business is built on finding great people and giving them the autonomy to improve shopper experiences that delight our users. We are looking for a passionate Software Engineering Leader who is driven to mentor, coach, and inspire teams while strengthening the culture at Flipp! As the Director of Engineering for Shopper you will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of this team, setting technical direction and driving major strategic and product initiatives. You will have significant strategic impact and influence the direction of the company, as well as direct responsibility for new and existing experiences loved by millions of our shoppers. You will do this together with an amazing team of talented, passionate engineers, engineering managers, and leaders from cross functional areas.





Most of the things you’ll work on:



Develop long-term vision and strategy for the Engineering vertical

Create and own technical roadmap and identify new engineering opportunities 

Uphold high quality software development

Build high quality teams by driving the growth and performance of existing team members and proactively recruit new team members

Own communication with cross-functional partners such as Product, Partner Technology, Sales, Operations, and other key functions for the vertical

Drive cross-functional alignment for Engineering teams’ focus and priorities






You’ll need to have:



Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Math, Engineering, or related field

10+ years of Software Development experience

5+ years of Software Development management experience

Advanced skills in leading multiple teams with total team size of 40+

Advanced skills in setting, communicating, implementing, and achieving objectives and goals through the direct management of teams in multiple levels

Advanced org planning, management, and change management skills across cross-functional groups and departments

Ability to facilitate discussions and drive clarity for teams

Ability to lead teams to drive innovation with ambiguity

Experience working as partner with Director of Product (or similar level) to jointly set long-term roadmap for teams

Broad knowledge and experience in software engineering org design, agile methodologies, and architectural principles

Experience leading multi-disciplinary teams, such as Android, iOS, or backend would be an asset






Here’s how we work:


From working with top technologies to sending you to industry-leading conferences, we will make sure you have all that you need to expand your knowledge and grow your career. We have a trust-based culture where all team members are empowered to work in the way that’s best for them to thrive.




Our culture is at the center of all that we do, and it has been recognized through numerous accolades over the past three years including: Best Workplaces in Canada, Deloitte 50 Best Managed, Best Workplaces in Canada for Women, Most Admired CEO and Top 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures.





Here’s how to apply:


If you’re interested in working with us on the future of shopping, click the “Apply now” button to submit your application. While experience and skill sets are valuable, growth potential and attitudes are equally important. If you’re prepared to grow dramatically with your team at a world-class learning organization, consider applying. We understand that the most creative solutions require diversity in thought and life experiences.




Flipp is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for all aspects of the selection process.

Reporting to the Vice President of Operations, the Senior Director of Franchise is a key contributor to the overall success of the Brick. They will provide strong leadership, strategic insight, business planning, development and growth for the division.





Responsibilities





Business Strategy: Develop a business and operational plan that will enhance current Franchise processes and build direction for growing the Franchise network in opportunity markets throughout Canada. 

 

Leadership: The individual will be managing a geographically dispersed team. He/she will need to assess the capability of the team, share and drive the behaviours that will ultimately create success for all. Each member of the team needs to understand expectations and deliver against those expectations. This individual will work closely with our large Franchisee/Entrepreneur Group to manage expectations, foster great communication and maintain strong relationships. 

 

Diversification: While the company has a strong footprint in Canada and a significant share of certain markets, there is potential for growth in many provinces. A creative, ambitious and lateral-thinking individual can create tremendous value for this business. 

 

Organizational Structure: The Senior Director of Franchise will report directly to the Vice President of Operations. The individual will have P & L responsibility for the performance of his/her business unit and will operate with a high level of autonomy.

 


Qualifications





The ideal candidate will have a solid background of achievements in Sales and Communication Leadership roles. People who are successful in this organization are smart, humble AND ambitious. 

 

As a key leadership role, the individual must have a strong track record of building high performance teams and in drawing out the best in individuals. He/she has vision, understands business metrics and can garner the trust and respect of others. 

 


Why The Brick?






Flexible “employer-paid” benefits including Health, Dental and Paramedical Services for you and your family 

Competitive pay 

Paid training 

Career progression program 

Access to free personal development training 

Employee discounts & Personal "Paid" days off 

Recognition, incentives, prizes and giveaways! 


 

Be a part of Canada’s largest home furnishings retailer!

We welcome all abilities to apply.

The Brick is committed to accommodating applicants and associates with disabilities. Should you require accommodation to participate fully in the recruitment process, please email careers@thebrick.com.

job_title: Director of Infrastructure and Public Works
description:
Are you an experienced Municipal and Infrastructure team leader looking for your next career opportunity? Do you have a strategic mindset with a desire to build meaningful and long-lasting relationships with the CAO, Council, Rate Payers and the Committee? Are you motivated, detail-oriented, and always up for a fresh challenge?




My client, a rural municipal organization, is looking for a 
Director of Infrastructure and Public Works
 to join their leadership team. The 
Director of Infrastructure and Public Works
 will be responsible for making recommendations to the CAO and Council with direction associated with departmental operations and infrastructure within the RM boundaries. The ideal candidate will be an experienced leader that knows how to empower and maintain high morale and maximize productivity.





My client is committed to:






Fostering a passionate and values-driven company culture and motivational work environment

Providing ongoing training and career development opportunities






What the Director of Infrastructure and Public Works does:






Manage and empower department staff in multifunctional areas in the implementation of department deliverables, delegate responsibilities appropriately and provide recommendation to achieve objectives

Create long term strategies, plans and operating policies to prioritize and implement capital programs/projects for fleet, construction, capital projects, rehabilitation, and expansion of new infrastructure

Support key stakeholders and other departments to ensure alignment in planning and delivery of projects such as road construction, irrigation, livestock regulations, and other rural projects as needed

Improve efficiencies and minimalize cost by capitalizing on partnerships and various funding opportunities

Develop practices and procedures that align with statutory requirements, quality standards

Ensure health and safety standards are implemented in all work-related locations

Communicate with external engineers and contractors as required

Respond effectively and efficiently to requests from ratepayers, businesses, and the public, coordinating appropriate action in accordance with approved municipal policy

Analyze and provide feedback on engineering drafts and development proposals related to infrastructure, transportation, utilities, and stormwater management

Manage the creation and execution of an asset management plan for the department

Attend and report into relevant boards and committees

Participate and report to Committees, Council, Planning, Department Head and other meetings when needed

Ensure performance of the department aligns with strategic objectives and budgets, and take corrective action when needed

Access and take advantage of grants, subsidies, and other sources of funding available through a variety of provincial and federal government programs as well as other agencies

Finalize design choice and determine materials and equipment for construction, repair and maintenance jobs. Maintain high quality and workmanship at a reasonable cost for public’s safety and convenience

Purchase goods and services as outlined by finance, purchasing and procurement policies

Communicate activities and operations to the CAO






What the successful candidate will bring:






Post-secondary certification or degree in civil, transportation or structural engineering, or a related discipline - a degree in public administration, business, management or relevant professional designation will be considered

10+ years of management experience at a strategic level - within the public sector and knowledge pertaining to responsibilities of this role is preferred

Previous experience working with a senior management team

Familiarity with public policy development, municipal government planning and decision-making processes

Proficient problem solving and conflict management skills

Ability to excise tact, discretion, and confidentiality

Excellent analytical, research, project management and presentation skills and function effectively in a high-volume workplace to ensure deadlines have been met

Excellent written and verbal communication

Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office

Ability to work under pressure

Inspection of work

Experience working with Contractors

Engineering knowledge is an asset






In return, what you can expect:






Opportunities to grow within the role

Competitive salary

Comprehensive benefits package including health and dental benefits

Positive work culture

Pension plan






Only candidates already eligible to work in Canada will be reviewed. Only qualified candidates will be contacted. Salary and other compensation will be based on the experience of the selected candidate.
