March 18, 2022

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the Posting End Date above.


Job End Date 




Job Summary



To plan, direct and administer all aspects of food services. Makes strategic decisions regarding the long-term development and planning for residence dining, and catering throughout conference season.

This position is responsible for the oversight of food service on the Okanagan campus. Specifically, the Manager will provide leadership and oversight of the operations and the administration office for Food Services. This position provides strategic leadership and is responsible for the recruiting, scheduling, training and performance management of Food Service employees.


ORGANIZATIONAL STATUS 


Reports to the Associate Director, Food Services and acts as a member of the Food Services leadership team. Works collaboratively with the Executive Chef, Nutritionist & Well-being Coordinator and Manager, Food Services Retail. Provides leadership and supervision for supervisory and front-line staff performing the entire breadth of food service operations. Interacts regularly with SHHS management and employees, Humans Resources and other departments, clients and suppliers.


WORK PERFORMED 


Strategic Leadership


Responsible for implementation of strategic plan and direction for on campus food services. Assesses and manages the risks of plans and organizational changes involved in future projects. 

In collaboration with the Food Services and SHHS leaders, establishes and communicates broad plans and goals consistent with the department's vision, values, and long-term business plans. 

Plans, develops, recommends and implements new organizational policies and procedures to improve product and service quality. Provides clarity and direction on policies and procedures to managers and staff. 

Responsible for the day-to-day operation of residence dining. Responsible for catering operations Oversees production and distribution of food items from multiple production areas for summer conferences, commissary distribution, and catering. Ensures food and service quality standards are met. 

Strategizes with Facilities on sustainability initiatives and waste management, and implements new procedures. 


Operational & Administrative Responsibilities


Manages catering functions, sets quality standards and ensures client expectations are met. 

Consults with clients and collaborates with Executive Chef on developing menus, negotiating services rates, developing and executing event contracts. 

Manages food, liquor and supplies including preparation of detailed function sheets to achieve budgeted function cost. 

Coordinates with external suppliers and service providers to ensure availability of items required for functions. 

Ensures financial records are current. Meets budget targets for catering with specific food on food and labour costs. 


Training and Development


Manages performance of food services staff, including coaching, motivating, recruiting, training, disciplining (up to and including termination of employment), in collaboration with SHHS Human Resources personnel and in accordance with collective agreement and administrative requirements. 

Determines proper staffing levels. Writes, reviews and manages employee schedules for all areas of responsibility to meet campus demand and budgetary targets. 

Ensures high standards of sanitation are maintained, and ensures work is performed in compliance with health board, Foodsafe, UBC policy, and WCB and University safety guidelines. Ensures compliance with liquor standards, liquor licensing requirements and “Serving it Right” standards including tracking of related training. 

Works to identify opportunities for ongoing development and training of catering service staff. Initiates, develops and delivers training programs for catering service staff. Performs ongoing assessments of required service skills and responding with related training programs. 


Financial Responsibilities


Manages hours of operation for units under their control to effectively meet marketplace service expectations while ensuring financial sustainability is achieved. 

Manages relationships with food trucks and local restaurants, including setting up new vendors as campus partners and scheduling food trucks on campus. 

Oversees and manages summer conference services to ensure financial success. Negotiates contracts and meets with clients and customers as required. 

Oversees the management and development of a successful product mix all locations, in partnership with the Executive Chef. 

Ensures sales and purchasing ledgers and general ledger reconciliations follow established procedures. 

Plans, forecasts and approves annual budgets for all areas of responsibility, in alignment with departmental financial plans. 

Manages the student meal plans in conjunction with finance and communications managers. Researches, assesses and makes adjustments to the programs as required. 

Oversees equipment maintenance and repair for the residence dining hall. 


General Responsibilities


Leads the assessment and evaluation of residence dining food services. Follows up with inquires and feedback with client, production kitchen and staff to ensure that established standards are being maintained. Provides feedback, coaching and guidance where necessary on any areas that do not meet established expectations 

Develops and maintains relationships with student leaders to facilitate regular, open dialogue and communication. Maintains forums for resident feedback, including but not limited to chairing a residence food committee and overseeing/participating in alternate feedback collection processes. Provides support and works directly with student groups as required. 

Participates on University and departmental committees. 

Prepares reports and special projects as required. 

Performs other duties as assigned. 



CONSEQUENCE OF ERROR 


This position is responsible for provision of food and services that support the health and well-being of the UBC campus community, visitors, and students living in residence. Failure to provide quality, service and value could negatively impact the financial performance of the department, disrupt the academic mission of the University, and damage the reputation of the department and the University as a whole. Failure to ensure high standards of hygiene and food preparation could disrupt the academic mission of the University. Failure to make sound business decisions will adversely impact sales. UBC Food Services, an ancillary department, relies on the sales from this area to maintain its daily operations.


SUPERVISION RECEIVED 


Works with a high level of independence. Work is reviewed in terms of achievement of long-term goals and profitability for all areas of responsibility. Reports to the Associate Director, Food Services.


SUPERVISION GIVEN 


Directly manages approximately 9 supervisors and indirectly manages approximately 100 food service workers.



Qualifications



Minimum

Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. A minimum of 6 years of experience or the equivalent combination of education and experience.



Preferred



Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. A minimum of 6 years of experience or the equivalent combination of education and experience. University degree in business administration, commerce or hotel administration preferred. Experience with a large commercial food service operation, preferably in a University or College environment. Demonstrated experience in food production, administration, staff scheduling, and staff management in a unionized environment.

Articulate with demonstrated written and verbal communication skills. Supportive leadership style and demonstrated ability to be a team player. Effective problem resolution and analytical skills. Ability to demonstrate judgement, exercise decisions and implement strategies. Strong organizational management skills. Ability to exhibit tact and diplomacy. Demonstrated customer service skills. Demonstrated competence in financial management. Current knowledge on best practices or comparable work experience. Ability to work flexible hours and days of the week.

description:
A new dimension to your career.





Masterpiece Studio’s culture of innovation is engrained in everything we do. For us, breaking barriers isn’t just a once-in-a-while occurrence– it’s a part of our everyday routine. Why? Because this company lives on the cutting edge of tech, art, and business theory. Our immersive 3D VR design pipeline empowers creatives to envision and change our future world, and our work environment does much the same. In fact, the people at Masterpiece are very similar to the products they work on: highly inventive but always grounded in artistry and tangible results.




Essentially, our team is anything but one-dimensional. Forget the classic management hierarchy– from the admin space to the technical side, every person here provides valuable insights and a willingness to pivot. We’re intrinsically motivated to do our best individually, but we’re also here to support each other as needed. At Masterpiece, it's all about blending highly professional results with a collaborative atmosphere.




We believe our people are at their best when they are passionate about the work they do. The projects you will work on here will be ones you won’t want to stop talking about, researching, and exploring every chance you get. Our team enables individuals to develop their skills, so you’ll never be put in a box– but we will challenge you to take the reins and step outside of it.




So if you’ve got a thirst for knowledge and a passion for disrupting the status quo, we’d love to talk. Masterpiece is always looking for big dreamers to help build the new world in 3D.





The Role





We are on a mission to simplify 3D production with VR UX design, moving it from being a complex process done by a few technical artists to being something that can be done by anyone. This exciting new role will ensure we stay at the forefront of human-centered spatial design as we create new UX for our VR environment and machine learning tools.




Our Head of UX - VR will bring a passion for human-driven design and strategic thinking to lead UX direction at a project/product level. As the UX leader they are expected to establish, drive and articulate a vision that champions user-centric, creative problem solving and delivers a polished and creative user experience that delivers accelerated time to value.




As influenced by the consumers' reception and experience, the Head of UX is constantly uncovering a deeper understanding of the “why” behind user behaviour and directing the UX team to evolve the product experience, ensuring that best practice design is effectively identified and implemented.




Reporting to the CEO and working closely with the Director of Operations, Chief Creative Officer, and Chief Technical Officer, the Head of UX is responsible for leading and building a UX team, communicating insights and recommendations across teams, and seeking alignment of design, research, development, and engineering in order to implement changes that advance business needs.





Specifically, this role will be accountable for activities including:






Synthesizing and clearly communicating the vision for UX

Identifying design problems and devising elegant solutions

Iterating designs and solutions efficiently and intelligently

Distilling users’ desired outcomes into actionable product features eg. templates, presets

Defining clearer training requirements to ensure users reach their desired outcomes

Creating an in-app gamified training system with tooltips, images, and videos

Discovering ways to anticipate users’ needs and help them based on their behaviours

Ensuring the product and features are valuable to our target audience, including non-technical creatives and indie game developers

Making strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core, and new, functions and features

Leading and growing the UX team over time






The Day to Day






We suspect our next hire will accomplish their goals by:






Spearheading the execution of ideas to create intuitive and easy to use products of the highest level of craft and execution

Learning directly from active and target user experiences, including conducting research, understanding the competitive landscape, and creating consumer scenarios

Ideating incentives, rewards, prompts to increase user engagement and retention, based on observations of user behaviour

Translating concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups, and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences

Designing and delivering wireframes, user stories, user journeys, and mockups for optimal 3D pipeline in VR

Working closely with Instructional Designer to create in-app learning content using product-led growth

Partnering with engineering and product leads to build alignment on priorities for product design and execution

Working with machine learning researchers to automate and simplify the 3D creation process

Collaborating with other internal teams and external stakeholders

Fostering a strong, collaborative design practice, developing design talent, and building a thriving culture where designers grow in their careers and feel a strong sense of inclusion and belonging






What we believe our next hire will bring to the business:






Proven experience in UX leadership roles:






UX design (5-10 years)

Working in XR, with preference to VR (2+ years)

Director-level role leading, managing, and growing UX teams (5-10 years)






Demonstrated expertise in: 






Working on successfully released software (ideally productivity/creative software)

Working knowledge of Unity 2020

Data-driven design

XR interaction toolkit

VR

User-centered design (UCD) practices, including planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability, and accessibility concerns

Standard UX Software such as Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer

Design tools: Figma, Miro, Visio, Fireworks, Photoshop, Illustrator, and Dreamweaver

Basic understanding of traditional 3D asset creation and animation (Blender, Zbrush, 3DS Max, Maya, MotionBuilder, etc) and 3D VR Creative Tools such as Adobe Medium, Gravity Sketch

Agile Scrum






It would be beneficial (though not required) if they also have working knowledge of:






Unreal Engine

Unity Animation

Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript 






What You’ll Get By Joining Our Team






You will have the chance to lead an industry.





Many people only dream of having the opportunity to set the standard in art, tech, and business– but if you have the talent, Masterpiece has the power to make it your new normal. We work in a space where things are constantly changing, which means you’ll always have a new puzzle to solve. If you’re inspired by overcoming the impossible with stellar teammates by your side, Masterpiece is the place to bring your best to even better.





You will feel the impact of your work.





At Masterpiece, you have the power to shape your career, doing the things you love most on projects with serious impact. We pride ourselves on pushing boundaries, so we encourage conversations about how to do things better– and when it’s your turn to speak up, this team will always have your back.





You will be a lifelong learner.





Joining the Masterpiece team means committing to continuous development and curiosity. After all, it’s hard to stay stagnant in an industry as dynamic as ours. We’ll work with you to find the common ground between our overarching goals and your personal interests, so you can expand your skillset to a whole new level.





Perks






Shape the future of VR creation for gaming, animation, and the metaverse

Partner with the biggest players in tech

Direct access to our C-Level

Freedom to build and innovate beyond your job description

Remote work opportunities





Masterpiece Studio is bringing cutting-edge machine learning and cutting-edge VR technologies together to enable hundreds of millions of people to create 3D content. This tight-knit team of strong individuals is working together to make a massive impact and change an industry.




Masterpiece Studios is years ahead of anybody else in the world, leading an industry with a simplified full solution to make real-time 3D content. With many of the top companies in the world partnering with us, there is an immense opportunity to grow.




“Against all odds, people thought it couldn’t be done, but this passionate team came together, and found a way to break through, to have breakthrough technology and make it all work.” - Jon Gagne, CEO of Masterpiece Studio




We’re taking on the Goliaths of the world– and we're winning.





EEOC





Masterpiece Studio is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are given consideration regardless of race, religion, colour, gender, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class as provided in applicable employment laws. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at

description:
Are you looking for that career that will allow you to combine your clinical expertise and your proven leadership skills? If you feel, you can deliver success by implementing strategies that focus the efforts of individuals on business goals, individual goals, team goals and translating them into positive outcomes - we want to hear from you.



Responsibilities



Under the administrative direction of the Health Service Administrator and the clinical direction of the Regional Director of Diagnostic Services, the Chief Technologist is responsible and accountable for


 Directing, organizing, controlling, coordinating and supervising all aspects of the day-to-day activities and operations of the laboratory and its departments, in consultation with regional technologist to ensure clinical quality consistency, standardization, benchmarking and evidence informed practice.

 Efficient management of financial, technical, equipment and human resources and planning in relation to allocated budgets to achieve an annual balanced budget mandate, including contribution and advice to Health Service Administrator on capital planning, as appropriate.

 Ensuring efficient and effective laboratory services, communication and technical interpretation and opinion to stakeholders, health care professionals and patients/service users.

 Performing and supervising diagnostic testing in biochemistry, hematology, blood bank, urology and microbiology as required, and ensuring compliance with all quality controls, professional practice and governance standards, policies and procedures, including, but not limited to health and safety, infection control, training requirements, legal and ethical requirements and accreditation standards.



Shift Rotation/Hours of work:
: Days - 08:00 to 16:00, rotating


 Lakes District Hospital 
 is a 12 acute bed hospital that offers emergency services, laboratory, diagnostic imaging, rehabilitation, pharmacy. There is one labour/delivery/recovery suite and 1 palliative care room. There are provision for public health, mental health and addictions, and home and community care service, as well as local physician and emergency services.


 Burns Lake 
 has a population of 1,779 (2021) local residents and serves the surrounding areas of the Regional District of Bulkley-Nechako estimating a population of 7,000. Wilderness and some of BC's largest freshwater lakes where sport fishing is a popular activity for both locals and tourists surround Burns Lake. Check out Burns Lake for more information on this family friendly community.


What Northern Health has to offer you!



 Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.

 Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service

 Relocation Incentive is available for eligible positions

 Employee referral program

 Employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities

 "Loan Forgiveness Programs" offered through the Federal and BC Government

 Spectacular outdoor activities and the shortest commutes in BC




Qualifications




 Graduation from an accredited Medical Laboratory Science training program.

 Current General Certification with the Canadian Society for Medical Laboratory Science (CSMLS) and eligible for membership with the BC Society of Laboratory Sciences (BCSLS) and/or CSMLS.

 Successful completion of the Advanced Registered Technologist (ART) course.

 Five years post Registered Technologist (RT) experience including two (2) years' related supervisory experience, or an equivalent combination of training, management experience and education acceptable to the hospital.




Skills And Abilities




 Management: Demonstrated ability to organize work, set objectives and establish priorities. Manages time and resources, implements activities to promote cooperation among the interdisciplinary team, supervises responsibilities of others, and collaborates across disciplines.

 Leadership: Promotes staff morale, engagement, and risk-taking. Demonstrates creative planning for change and innovations, implementation of NH policies or other protocols, and ongoing professional development of self and others.

 Knowledge Integration: Integrates best practice and current research evidence to support professional practice decisions and actions.

 Communication: Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively with clients, families, the public, medical staff and the members of the interdisciplinary team using, oral written and computer communication means. Demonstrated ability to effectively resolve conflict.

 Critical Thinking: Demonstrated ability to integrate and evaluate pertinent data (from multiple sources) to problem-solve and make decisions effectively. Applies the problem solving process demonstrating critical thinking and decision making skills using a systems approach.

 Teamwork: Demonstrated ability to foster teamwork and a commitment to excellence in the provision of client care.

 Teaching: Ability to teach clients and others both one-on-one and in groups.

 Equipment: Demonstrated computer skills including the use of Meditech and Windows based programs. Demonstrated data analysis skills including appropriate data analysis and reporting tools. Demonstrated ability in the use of e-mail and word processing. Ability to operate other related equipment as required in the specific practice area.

 Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.




Who We Are



Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation's communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.

Value

At Saputo, our best comes from our people. We’re a talented and caring team with a longstanding history of excellence. Since our first days delivering cheese on a bicycle, we’ve grown into a leading global dairy processor by staying true to the culture that defines us. Each of our employees is committed to uphold our tradition of care, quality, and passion through food, and together, we foster an environment where we can all make contributions that matter–from our manufacturing plants to our office locations and everywhere in-between.


Overview Of The Role


Reporting to the Senior Vice President, Human Resources, the Director, Human Resources is responsible for promoting the Company culture and values, and leading HR initiatives related to the BC Operations in both Abbotsford and Port Coquitlam. As a key member of the national HR team, you will lead a team in BC accountable for employee engagement, labour relations, compensation, talent acquisition & retention, employee development and health and & safety.

In addition to these responsibilities you will act as the HR strategic business partner for the sales leadership team.



How you will make contributions that matter:




Partners with the business to understand and execute the human resources and talent strategy particularly as it relates to current and future talent needs, employee relations, recruiting, retention, and succession planning;

Act as a strategic HR business partner for the leadership team and employees at all levels on policies, procedures and practices pertaining to human resources, benefits and health & safety;

Act as the lead liaison for Union and Employee Relations issues; understand and apply our 3 collective agreements with the business; 

Advise and implement continuous improvement on structures, compensation, and succession planning;

Champion the Saputo Culture across the operations, bringing a unified approach to the business;

Take a leadership position and collaborate with the business to implement best HR practices across all Plant & Sales related departments;

Lead internal and external recruitment and ensure a comprehensive onboarding experience for new employees; 

Lead and manage various administrative duties related to human resources (i.e. insurance documents, assistance with the administration of salaries, maintenance of personnel files, etc.). 





You are best suited for the role if you have the following qualifications: 




University degree in Human Resource Management or related field

CHRP designation would be an asset

Minimum 10 years Human Resource Generalist experience. 3-5 years of Human Resources Management experience

Labour relations experience working with unions required

Experience of working with salaried employees

Dependable, flexible and team oriented with a history of being able to work independently

Strong track record of leading a team

Strong communication, influencing, interpersonal and analytical skills

Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)





We support and care for our employees and their families by providing:




Competitive salaries

Saputo products at a discounted price

Main Activities



Manage the overall Reverse Mortgage acquisition program, across all media, working closely with various stakeholders such as agency partners, legal, operations, finance, etc.

Oversee, track and implement the substantial digital banking marketing budget (and associated projects) flawlessly

Elevate the brand and product offerings across all consumer touch points and work closely with the Analytics/Optimization lead to lower overall cost per acquisition 

Working closely with the Reverse Mortgage Marketing team, plan and roll out engaging marketing tactics across a diverse digital media mix that achieves awareness and acquisition targets 

Build and execute innovative marketing strategies that will grow the overall client base over both the short and long term

Lead customer acquisition strategies that connect with the consumer and are scalable 

Build and develop key partnerships and other alternative/non-traditional tactics that will support brand product adoption and customer referrals

Keep up-to-date with marketing communications and e-commerce trends that can be shared with the team and help inspire creative/alternative solutions




Knowledge/Skill Requirements




University education in Marketing, Commerce, Business or related experience.

4+ years of experience in a client-side or leading agency environment, strategizing and executing acquisition programs that ultimately drive sales for the organization

Strong knowledge and experience with tracking and quantifying marketing performance across all consumer touch points 

Deep experience managing campaigns in SEM, Display, and Social

Excellent time management, vendor management and organizational skills 

Strong attention to detail and never satisfied with the average

Strong experience managing marketing campaigns from strategy to post-launch

Introduction


*Work location is flexible*

Information and Data are some of the most important organizational assets in today’s businesses. As a Security Consultant, you will be a key advisor for IBM’s clients, analyzing business requirements to design and implement the best security solutions for their needs. You will apply your technical skills to find the balance between enabling and securing the client's organization with the cognitive solutions that are making IBM the fastest growing enterprise security business in the world.


Your Role and Responsibilities


Cybersecurity is one of the most critical issues of our generation. No other company has the powerful combination of diverse talent, industry-leading security technology and services, global reach and cognitive capabilities, powered by Watson, to combat the cybersecurity threats.

Do you want to work with the best and diverse Security talent? If so keep reading!

IBM is looking to expand our Security Intelligence & Operations Consulting (SIOC) competency in our Canadian Security Services practice which focuses on helping our clients build their security intelligence and operations centers from setting a strategy/roadmap, or optimizing an existing Security Operations Center (SOC) using our proven methodology in an effort to identify and respond to Information Security Attacks.

Our goal in our SIOC practice for our consultants is to become a “trusted advisor” to our clients, that can speak to all levels of client management from security analysts to director / c-level executives, in the areas of security intelligence and operations including advance persistent threats (APTs) relevant to our clients industry, advanced security controls, incident response process and procedures, Security Operations, metrics and analytics, with technical knowledge of various security technologies (e.g. security information and event management (SIEM), incident response tools, etc.)

In this role, you will partner with other IBM consultants from other IBM practices to deliver the best possible solution to our clients as well as assisting and delivering our SIOC services to our clients.


Consulting Skills




Ability to work easily with diverse and dynamic teams

Ability to work in a matrix management model

Ability to manage multiple client engagements or projects

Ability to lead and deliver a project based on different project methodologies

Effective writing, communication and presentation skills

Ability to lead groups as a facilitator

Ability to shape client expectations

Ability to apply complex concepts to new situations and client needs, following limited guidance from other team members.

Willing to travel up to 50% or as needed by client(s).



*Work location is flexible*


Required Technical and Professional Expertise




English Fluent (written and verbal)

At least 5 years of experience in management consulting and systems integration or Managed Security Services in a top tier professional services firm with knowledge of SIEM, ETL and SOAR technologies, ticketing and workflow orchestration, Threat-Intelligence Platforms, active defense, UseCase construction and more.

At least 3 years experience working in projects in one of the core SIOC domains: SOC governance, organization design, operations management, incident investigation and response process and procedures

Degree with focus in Cybersecurity or technical equivalent

Current knowledge of security threat intelligence and recent attack vectors 

English and French Fluent if working from Montreal,Quebec location




Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise




Certified or working towards Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), or other Security Management Certifications (ISSMP; CRISC; CISM; etc)

Good understanding or proficiency in information security and compliance regulations (PCI, SOX, HIPAA, NERC)

Good knowledge or understanding of Information Security regulations, frameworks and leading practices (such as MITRE, NIST, ISO, COBIT, SANS,)



Must have the ability to work in Canada without sponsorship.


About Business Unit


IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.

This role requires you to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to your start date. Full vaccination refers to receiving dosage of COVID-19 vaccines that provide full protection in accordance with Canada Public Health and WHO guidance (full series of a 2 dose vaccine plus 14 days or a one dose vaccine plus 14 days from the last dose). Proof of vaccination status will be required. Booster vaccination requirements may be required. If you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons, we offer accommodations in accordance with applicable law.


Your Life @ IBM


Are you craving to learn more? Prepared to solve some of the world's most unique challenges? And ready to shape the future for millions of people? If so, then it's time to join us, express your individuality, unleash your curiosity and discover new possibilities.

Every IBMer, and potential ones like yourself, has a voice, carves their own path, and uses their expertise to help co-create and add to our story. Together, we have the power to make meaningful change – to alter the fabric of our clients, of society and IBM itself, to create a truly positive impact and make the world work better for everyone.

It's time to define your career.


About IBM


IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.

Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business.

At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.


Location Statement


This role will involve working with technology that is covered by Export Regulations sanctions. If you are a Foreign National from any of the following US sanctioned countries (Cuba, Iran, North Korea, and Syria) on a work permit, you are not eligible for employment in this position.


Being You @ IBM

Our community is steadily growing and we are doing the same. We now need an experienced team leader to plan and run the day to day operations of our Public Works mandate as one of two management positions in the department. 




Reporting to the Director of Public Works this position is responsible for providing operations management, regular crew supervision, ongoing oversight, and technical assistance in the delivery of potable water, the collection of sanitary sewage, the maintenance of roads and drainage facilities, traffic management, the management of solid waste, building and fleet maintenance, parks and recreation operations, and maintenance of dikes and any capital work assigned by the Director of Public Works, all achieved through a combination of internal staff resources and the management of third party contractors and consultants. 




We need someone that has 5 years of experience in this field, and holds a diploma in civil engineering, a level of EOCP accreditation, an A.Sc.T designation, or an equivalent combination of qualifications and experience.  




You need to be as comfortable in an office as the field, able to use modern computer programs to read, develop and analyze everything from purchase orders to time sheets; contract documents to budget forecasts; and policy standards to operating procedures. 

Core competencies are critical – being cooperative while decisive, exhibiting leadership, strategic thinking, budgeting acumen, and contract management. We and our operations crew need someone who can not only lead and deliver the excellent services we provide in this community but make them better. You need to thrive in a team-based, safety conscious operations environment while being a future visionary for the community’s infrastructure, services and amenities. 




This is a great place to work. We value productive and healthy work places and lifelong education and training.  In addition to a competitive six figure salary we also offer an excellent comprehensive benefits package. Visit 
www.golden.ca/jobs
 to see the full job description. 




Golden is a resort community just 2.5 hours from Calgary at the very heart of the six most highly acclaimed Canadian mountain parks, at the junction of the spectacular Kicking Horse and Columbia Rivers, and located between the peaks of the Purcell and Rocky Mountain ranges. With a population of about 4,000, our entire staff of 35 provides a full range of municipal services. You’re going to love it here.  




Come discover a place where community still matters, and a town you’ll never want to leave.

job_title: Associate Director, IT at Child Development Institute
description:
Child Development Institute (CDI) is seeking an Associate Director, IT to join its team.
 The Associate Director, IT will provide direction, operational management, strategy, and vision for CDI’s IT infrastructure. This position is responsible for the day-to-day operation, as well as the evolution and enhancement of these services ensuring CDI is consistently receiving the best possible return on its technology investments. 




In addition to delivering excellent technology operations, this role will help prioritize technology investments ensuring alignment with stakeholders and organization’s strategy. As a senior member of the IT team, this role will act as a trusted advisor to deliver a sustainable IT structure that supports the organization’s financial, operational and growth goals. 

 


CDI is seeking to meet candidate who have the following experience:



A minimum of 5+ years of progressive experience in IT

A minimum of 3 years of experience in an IT management capacity, including managing an IT program, managing staff and vendors, implementing policies and procedures, managing the delivery of IT support services

A University Degree in Computer Science or in related field



 



TECHNICAL


•    Demonstrated experience in developing and monitoring IT strategies, operational plans, and budgets

•    Knowledge of project management methodologies and demonstrated experience managing concurrent IT projects

•    Experience in planning, implementing, and managing cloud-based infrastructure, platforms or services

•    Demonstrated technical knowledge including, but not limited to: 

o   Microsoft Office 365 platform and services

o   Microsoft Windows and Microsoft Windows Server-based applications, services and technologies

o   Local and wide area network management (routing, switching, wireless, etc.)

o   Both on-premises and cloud-hosted infrastructures

o   IT security infrastructure (e.g., VPN, firewalls, anti-virus, etc.) and best practices

o   Software development lifecycle and methodologies


 



SKILLS & ABILITIES



Deep understanding of information management practices including information lifecycle management, data modelling, data warehousing methodology, data quality, data governance, analytics and predictive modeling, security and data protection

Demonstrated understanding of how technology facilitates business priorities

Exceptional skills in project management, scope management, workload planning, budgeting resources and tracking

Capable of working in a team or independently, with excellent multitasking abilities

Experience leading, overseeing/managing a team or group(s) of moderate to large or in size, scope, risk and complexity

Excellent communication skills to “bridge the gap” between IT and end users 

Strong methodological software implementation capabilities, excellent troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills

Expertise on systems architecture, BI/data planning and data tables, data integrity, security and the ability to ask probing diagnostic questions

Proven ability to manage and deliver against large scale projects involving multiple stakeholders across the organization and external to the organization

Be a dedicated and flexible team player able to interact with team members, and colleagues at all levels of the organization.

Demonstrated ability to work in a respectful manner with groups from diverse backgrounds and experiences  



 



Compensation


·        $105,000 - $120,000 

·        CDI offers a highly competitive total compensation package that includes Group benefits after 30 days. 


 


Child Development Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value inclusivity & diversity in the workplace. We actively encourage applications from members of groups with historical and/or current barriers to equity, including, but not limited to,


First Nations, Métis and Inuit peoples, and all other Indigenous peoples

members of groups that commonly experience discrimination due to race, ancestry, colour, religion and/or spiritual beliefs, or place of origin

persons with visible and/or invisible (physical and/or mental) disabilities; and

persons of marginalized sexual orientations, gender identities, and gender expressions.


 

We recognize that many of these identities intersect and that therefore, equity, diversity and inclusion can be complex. We value the contributions that each person brings and are committed to ensuring full and equal participation for all in our community.

 


To Apply



 


This search is being conducted on behalf of the Child Development Institute by 
crawfordconnect
, a search firm specializing in recruiting leaders for Canada’s non-profit sector, on behalf of our client. If someone you know may be interested in this position, please feel free to forward this document – we’d be pleased to connect with them.

 


Submit your application through our website, by April 4, 2022. 



Please visit: http://crawfordconnect.com/for-candidates/job-openings/   


Select the role and ‘Apply’ to upload your cover letter and resume in two separate documents. 

Issues with applying? Please email info@crawfordconnect.com.


 


For more information about the position, please contact Joanne Ticknor at joanne@crawfordconnect.com or 416-738-8993. We thank all applicants for applying, however, only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

9 month contract for a bright and enthusiastic individual with a “can do” attitude working with Account Services and Producers to manage the client’s production budgets, estimates and cash flow. Must build and maintain a strong working relationship with Account and Production teams and work as a liaison assisting them with client financial requirements and to uphold internal control policies. 


What you own: 



Management Reporting - Client Finance 



Ensure that all client financial reporting and processes are implemented and executed 

Design and create monthly budget control report on assigned clients. Review with Account Services for issues and resolve prior to client presentations 


WIP management
: 

Ensure all projects are setup according to client contractual requirements and comply with internal/external reporting policies. Maintain accuracy of records in the financial information system 

Issue invoices in accordance with client requirements in a timely and accurate manner, ensuring all applicable taxes (provincial or country) and foreign exchange are applied to fees and costs prior to generating. Monitor project cash flows and liaise with client A/P teams for payments 

Ensure job costing is compliance with all internal control processes and all project related documentation is appropriately archived for audit in a timely manner 

Review project estimates with account services and producers to ensure, complete, and accurate before client presentation 

Plan and lead monthly billing meetings with Account Service and producers to review all active client projects. Prepare unrecognized revenue analysis for review and recognize revenue in compliance with SBOX requirements 

Work with producers to reconcile the job upon completion and notify clients regarding the job status (i.e. reconcile within 60 days from date of completion) 

Review aged purchase orders and work-in-progress. Follow up with budget owner or supplier to resolve issues 

Lead Client Y/E processes with oversight from Client Finance manager. 

Document & provide an accurate up to date WIP report to Client’s finance team and internal AM team identifying amounts to be accrued that are unbilled 

Provide Client and AM team with Final Aged A/R Statement highlighting that all amounts that are unpaid must be recorded or accrued on their end 

Ensure all jobs are closed and reconciled unless carrying over the year end. 

Work with Account team to set up new Fiscal time tracking jobs according to the way scopes are sold or must be reported against in time reporting. 


Cash management
: 

Bi-monthly account receivable statements are sent to client 

Follow up collections Emails to appropriate Finance and Agency account management. 

Escalation - Items greater than 45 immediately flagged to Client finance manager and Sr. Account lead. 

Monitor A/R against approved credit limits. Escalate approaching limit (A/R + unbilled) 


Risk management
: 

o Assist with analysis and review of departmental revenue forecast for budget/operational plan inputs. Assess reasonableness and report directly to Client Finance Manager 

o Mitigate risk exposure of JP\TBWA and our clients by enforcing any control issues and escalating risk items to financial management 

o Address various requests between the clients, account services, producers, and finance when necessary, including any ad hoc client financial reporting and analysis (client audits, quarterly reporting, and time reconciliation) 






Financial Reporting – As assigned to you / cross train as back-up to peers 



Weekly 



Prepared and distribute Monday morning Weekly WIP report shared with all accounts 

Weekly Time report 

Semi- monthly Aged A/R report and Credit monitoring for Client and internal management 



Monthly 



Prepare and analyze reclassification of client advances (WIP) 

Revenue recognition – including accruals & deferrals Intercompany revenue (OMD), and foreign exchange non-Canadian billed revenue 

Monthly client reporting - Time & costing for Account team to share with clients (client facing slides for decks as needed) 

On-going research and analyze of accounting issues as they arise, recommending appropriate accounting treatment when necessary 

AD-HOC - Assist with ad hoc financial reporting needs and analysis as required by the Client Finance Manager, Director of Finance & Operations, and Chief Financial Officer 






Audit (Client and or SOX) 



Provide back-up as required for quarterly internal audit samples – SOX 

Perform Client audits with supervision, document findings, and form appropriate conclusions 






Continuous Process Improvement Contributions: 



Recommend continuous improvements to increase productivity 

Coordinate with Client Finance Manager and system administrator to test new system updates and enhancements 






What qualifies you: 



Degree in accounting/finance 

Designated or enrolled in CPA program 

Optimistic attitude and keen analytical instincts 

Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills and able to work well with people at all levels of the organization such as Clients, Account Service, Finance, Studio Print/Broadcast Production, Traffic, and Media 

Relentless drive for answers and results, intrinsically motivated 

Ability to prioritize and have self-discipline. Highly ORGANIZED. 

Ability to adapt and manage multiple projects while meeting both fixed and moving deadlines 

Excellent proficiency in Excel 

Media Ocean (DDS) experience preferred 

Advertising Agency experience an asset 





At JP\TBWA we respect and value differences and we pride ourselves in attracting diverse talent from around the world. We encourage and foster an environment in which everyone feels respected and comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work. We appreciate people from different backgrounds with different points of view as this fosters creativity and enhances the quality of our work. We are an inclusive employer and recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, disability or age. We offer reasonable accommodations to job applicants with disabilities. Accommodations or assistance due to a disability are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All resumes will be reviewed and those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Being You @ IBM

tory Behind the Need

• Strong attention to detail

Post-secondary

CSC (Canadian Securities Course) certification an asset

2 rounds – with HM and another manager - 1 hour video interviews

description:
Clio is more than just a tech company–we are a global leader that is transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice .

We are currently seeking a highly motivated and skilled Payment Operations Analyst with a strong track record in Fraud and Risk Management and Custom Support, to join our Business Operations team.


What Your Team Does


The Payment Operations team, led by the Director of Payment Operations, is a brand new department and quickly growing team at Clio. The team is responsible for underwriting, fraud detection and prevention, dispute resolution, processor settlement and monitoring, custom pricing, and payments service escalations.

Payment Operations sits within our wider COO organization at Clio, which is focused on driving results for the company through strategic, operational, and data-driven improvements.


What you’ll work on:


We are looking for a forward-thinker who can comfortably interact with customers. Someone who understands and is deeply familiar with the payments industry, especially card payments. We are also looking for underwriting skills, to help vet new merchants for risk before they join Clio Payments.

Primary duties of the role include:


 Underwriting new merchant applications. 


 Reviewing open source information for merchants. 

 Conducting KYC reviews if required. 

 Conducting investigations into suspicious merchants and taking appropriate action. 

 Supporting merchants throughout the onboarding process. 


 Supporting Clio customers who have questions or escalations concerning payments, this will include: 


 Topics related to making and accepting payments. 

 Topics related to payments safety and security. 

 Topics related to onboarding to clio payments. 

 Topics related to product use. 

 Topics related to chargebacks and possible disputes. 

 Supporting merchant collections. 

 Interpreting and communicating the status of payment events in a customer’s account. 

 Supporting 1099k processes. 


 Other payments operations projects which may be required. 


 Projects will relate to building the team, processes and efficiency. 




What you may have:



 At least 1 years previous customer success / support experience, preferably in a card payments environment. 

 At least 1 years previous merchant underwriting experience, preferably in a card payments environment. 

 Familiarity with Stripe would be beneficial. 

 Comfortable working in a technical operations environment where regular interaction with developers is required. 

 Some data analysis and SQL experience is preferred. 

 A passion for customer service and the ability to sometimes manage difficult conversations. 

 Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to adapt to change in a high-growth business environment. 

 Ability to manage a wide variety of competing priorities. 

 Demonstrated strong interpersonal and communication skills, both written and oral. 

 Strong computer skills. 

 Strong logical and analytical skills. 

 
 Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 


Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion . We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers


About Clio


At Clio, we are on a mission to transform the legal experience for all. As the world's leading provider of cloud-based legal software, we provide lawyers with low-barrier, affordable solutions to manage and grow their firms more effectively, more profitably, and with better client experiences. Through the cloud, we believe that we can help create a more inclusive legal community and a more equitable legal system.

We are an award-winning team that has been recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies , Canada’s Most Admired Cultures and has topped Fast Company’s list of Most Innovative Companies . In line with our mission, we’ve been up to some big things, including becoming a multi-product company, launching a $1 million COVID-19 Legal Relief Initiative , and most recently, securing a US$110M Series E funding round and a USD $1.6B valuation.

This is a historic moment in the growth of legal technology! As the first legal practice management unicorn globally, and one of only a handful of Canadian unicorns, this is only the beginning. If you’ve ever wanted to do the best work of your career, while having a meaningful impact in the lives of others, then Clio is the place for you.

PointClickCare is the leading North American cloud-based healthcare software for the acute and long-term and post-acute care markets. For over 20 years, the company has held the same vision – to help the world care for vulnerable populations. Since its inception, PointClickCare has grown exponentially with over 1,700 employees today all working towards impacting the lives of millions. Recognized by Forbes as one of the Top 100 Private Cloud Companies and acknowledged by Waterstone Human Capital as Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture, PointClickCare leads the way in creating cloud-based software. 



With its recent acquisition of Collective Medical, PointClickCare solidifies its position as a high growth healthcare software provider, serving over 21,000 long-term and post-acute care providers and over 1,300 hospitals. Their shared mission to support vulnerable populations is allowing PointClickCare and Collective Medical to connect disparate points of care at scale faster than anyone else in the market.



For more information on PointClickCare, please connect with us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn.





Position Summary:


The President’s Office is seeking an an innovative, analytical and strategic thinker to join the team. Reporting to the Director, Operations, the Manager of Operations will support the President’s operational activities.  The role is highly visible, with opportunities to work with senior leaders and is well suited for an individual who enjoys solving complex problems, works effectively with cross-functional teams, and thrives in a dynamic setting. 



The President’s Office is a fast paced and dynamic team that handles complex, high priority and time sensitive initiatives.  This role is an integral part of the team’s ability to execute in a timely and meaningful way with significant impact to the organization.

 


Key Responsibilities:


·
         
Be a key contributor to the execution of the firm’s key operational, strategic initiatives

·
         
Lead various analyses and draw insights to help drive operational insights into the growth and profitability of the multiple businesses / teams reporting to the President

·
         
Collaborate with a variety of internal stakeholders (e.g., Finance, Marketing, Corporate Strategy, Corporate Development) across the firm to gather information, coordinate efforts, and identify opportunities for horizontal thinking

·
         
Support the development of “client-ready” presentations and financial analyses that drive conversations with customers, investors and other key external stakeholders

·
         
Create and co-own short and long-range business forecasts and various reporting packages used by the President to manage the business 

·
         
Communicate key analytical insights and decisions to stakeholders and senior leaders

·
         
Support the management of key relationships across all levels of the business

·
         
May require travel across the U.S. to accompany President on key trips

·
         
Availability some evenings and weekends for urgent situations.

  


Required Experience: 


·
         
Undergraduate or Bachelor’s degree a minimum; MBA a plus

·
         
3+ years of work experience

·
         
Investment Banking or Corporate Strategy experience required

·
         
Experience in Technology (SaaS) or Healthcare industries a plus

·
         
Strong business acumen, including a thorough understanding of valuation concept ts and public market research

·
         
Strong quantitative/analytical skills, including ability to build and visualize financial models

·
         
Strong communications (written/verbal), presentation and facilitation skills

·
         
Ability to work with internal and external stakeholders and navigate across matrix teams






Working at PointClickCare goes beyond the resume, because the work we perform makes a true difference in people’s lives. We build innovative healthcare technology for seniors and their caregivers that improve their quality of life and well-being on a daily basis. We believe work is so much more meaningful when you’re doing it with a higher purpose.



For more information on PointClickCare, please visit us on Glassdoor and LinkedIn

PointClickCare welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please contact recruitment@pointclickcare.com should you require any accommodations.

When we have no ongoing legitimate business need to process your information, we will either delete or anonymize it.  If you have any questions about how PointClickCare uses or processes your information, or if you would like to ask to access, correct, or delete your information, please contact PointClickCare’s human resources team: recruitment@pointclickcare.com

job_title: Director, Technical Insurance Operations, Commercial Lines
description:
Gallagher is a global leader in insurance, risk management and consulting services. We help businesses grow, communities thrive and people prosper. We live a culture defined by The Gallagher Way, our set of shared values and guiding tenets. A culture driven by our people, over 30,000 strong, serving our clients with customized solutions that will protect them and fuel their futures.



About The Role



Reporting to the Senior Vice President of National Operations, this position is responsible for development and delivery of technical insurance knowledge for new and existing staff. Successful candidate will have a demonstrated in depth understanding of various commercial lines products. Experience in facilitation of training programs preferred.



How You Will Affect The Business




Develop and facilitate the technical training portion of the GIFTT (Gallagher Fast Track Training) program. 

Validation of learning from GIFTT staff to ensure comprehension and allowing for knowledge to be put into practical use. 

Working with VP, Organizational Development, monitor GIFTT participants progress throughout the program and adjust where necessary. 

Provide front line support to new process learnings of GIFTT team and new commercial hires. 

Working with TP vendors (IIC, RIBO, IBAO, IBAC, Carriers) to source and procure additional training to round out offering. 

Develop and deliver timely refresher training for existing branch staff with CE accreditation where applicable. 

Working with National Ops Coordinator, develop e-learn modules. 

Work with GSE (Gallagher Standards of Excellence) leader to assist with special audit requests when required. 

Work with VP of Claims to develop and deliver specific training required from Gallagher Learning from Losses to avoid and mitigate future E&O claims. 



Critical Competencies



Minimum of 10 years commercial underwriting or placement experience. 

Must have CIP to facilitate in house CIP courses. 

Previous training experience preferred. 

Effective time management and change management skills. 

Proficient in MS Office applications with key strengths in PowerPoint and Excel. 

Excellent verbal and written communication skills. 

Motivated self-starter capable of working with minimal supervision. 

Able to build and sustain professional relationships at all levels of the organization. 

Able to manage individual work products associated with key responsibilities. 

Able to assess and adapt to different learning styles. 



Travel


Ability to travel to branches across Canada on occasion (as COVID restrictions permit) on occasion.


Office & Remote Work Arrangements


This role has the flexibility to be work remotely and/or be based out of any one of Gallagher's Canadian offices.



What We Can Offer You



Gallagher offers competitive salaries and bonus plans. We offer benefits, including; medical/dental, life & dependent life, AD & D, pension/group savings plan, employee stock purchase plan, educational expense reimbursement, employee assistance programs, discounted gym membership, opportunity for flexible work hours, paid sick days, personal days, employee education recognition program, employee referral bonus program and more.

We love to have fun and cultivate an enjoyable working environment. We have an active social club along with a service recognition program which ensures we share and celebrate the successes of our employees along with rewarding our employees for their achievements. We offer a diverse learning environment that challenges you to build on your strengths and to create new ones. We provide career pathing and advancement opportunities for our hard-working and dedicated employees.

We are an equal opportunity employer which values diversity in the workplace. As an equal opportunity employer we support and are happy to accommodate any individual needs in keeping with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Facility Manager - Rooms and Public Space

Do you enjoy helping others and building emotional connections to make people feel special and welcomed? If so, then we want YOU to be part of our Fairmont Royal York family.

Every day you will be responsible for engaging with our guests, clients and colleagues. You will create the essential Toronto experience at the hotel that has been a Canadian icon for over 93 years. You will be given the responsibility to ensure that our guests and colleagues feel WELCOMED, CARED FOR and INCREDIBLE. Being part of the Fairmont Royal York family is more than providing warm and consistent service. As an ambassador of Fairmont Royal York, you will take the initiatives necessary to turn moments into memories by taking the time to understand our guests' purposes: why are they staying at Fairmont Royal York, what is their length of stay and what are their preferences and passions? Making our guests feel heard and cared for creates an emotional connection to our brand and builds loyalty.

These emotional connections are not just for guests. As part of the Fairmont Royal York family, you will be tasked with creating impactful relationships with your colleagues.

As a Professional Leader, you will lead yourself through: positive orientation, self-development self-management, problem solving and decision making. You will lead others through: leading and engaging with your team, developing others and communicating effectively. You will lead the business by: being guest-focused, forward-thinking and planning, business awareness and business improvement.



What Is In It For You




 Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

 Extended Healthcare Plan Coverage

 Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within the Company and across the world!

 Ability to make a difference through our Corporate Social Responsibility activities, like Planet 21

 All Heartists Travel Program for stays at properties world-wide




What You Will Be Doing




 Assure implementation of Accor Policies, standards and procedures.

 Oversee and ensure all Preventative Maintenance is carried out in a timely manner in accordance with FH&R standards.

 Carry out PM inspection on a daily basis to as many guestrooms as possible, ensuring they are up to standard. Rooms that are not up to standard must be placed out of inventory to commence Corrective maintenance.

 Manage the painting, finishing, carpentry, general maintenance, and upholstery colleagues by assigning daily work orders/tasks and inspecting completion and quality of work

 Manage colleague performance.

 Ensure all guest floor corridors are kept up to standard i.e. walls free from scuffmarks, baseboard is varnished and clean, Ice mix surroundings are clean.

 Responsible for marble repair and restoration in the entire hotel i.e. all guestrooms and public spaces. Inspection of all areas worked on by contractors to be done before and after work completion.

 Ensure colleagues have the necessary tools to do their job i.e. ensuring the correct tools are ordered in at timely manner.

 Upkeep and storage of guest room furniture i.e. ordering of glass tops of desks and tables, getting furniture refinished either by in-house finisher or outside contractor. Ensuring proper furniture fabric is ordered upon executive approval.

 Assist with Renovations: i.e. placing room out of inventory, room inspections, case-goods inspection. Along with contractor, ensuring rooms are up to standard during and upon completion of Renovations in adherence to Fairmont Hotels and Resorts standards.

 Ensure all lights and receptacles are in good working order, if not, to be reported and ensure it gets repaired ASAP.

 Maintain and control the Work Order System.

 Respond to work orders as requested and ensure they are all completed as required. Take the necessary steps needed to do this which may include contacting contractors, ordering parts or scheduling.

 Attend required training courses, workshops, seminars, and schooling to ensure that certificates and qualifications are up to date and current on management, brand, and maintenance skills as related to your job

 Will be required to work weekends, holidays and shift work as scheduled/required by the Director of Engineering to ensure the proper operations of the Hotel.

 Liaise between Housekeeping and Front Office to ensure room inventory is completed as quickly as possible .

 Perform other related duties as assigned.

 Utilizes employee feedback and an "open door" policy to identify and address employee problems or concerns in a timely manner.




Your Experience And Skills Include




 Must have experience In leading a team of Maintenance Employees, with preference to those who have worked in a unionized environment

 Ability to work effectively under pressure, changing conditions and priorities

 Ability to effectively review, assess and modify work as needed to ensure continual progress towards desired results

 Skill in use of computers and software programs associated with Property Operations

 5 years of experience in Maintenance, Technical, or Construction Fields preferred

 Excellent communications and interpersonal skills




Physical Aspects Of Position (included But Not Limited To)




 Constant standing and walking throughout shift

 Frequent lifting and carrying up to 50 lbs

 Constant kneeling, pushing, pulling, lifting

 Frequent ascending or descending ladders, stairs and ramps


Your team and working environment

For over 91 years, Fairmont Royal York has stood proudly as a Toronto landmark. When the hotel opened in 1929 it was the tallest building in the British Common Wealth and contained 1,048 rooms, a concert hall, library, extensive bakery, radio station and even a hospital. Today, this essential downtown landmark has completed a multi-million dollar transformation, reimagining its lobby, rooms, dining venues, event spaces, and Fairmont Gold - the property's exclusive hotel within a hotel luxury experience. Another stunning chapter for Fairmont Royal York has begun. To learn more, click here.

Visa Requirements: Must already be legally permitted to work in Canada.

In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid-19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Vaccination Policy.



Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion



We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for Accor?

We are far more than a worldwide leader. We welcome you as you are and you can find a job and brand that matches your personality. We support you to grow and learn every day, making sure that work brings purpose to your life, so that during your journey with us, you can continue to explore Accor's limitless possibilities.

By joining Accor, every chapter of your story is yours to write and together we can imagine tomorrow's hospitality. Discover the life that awaits you at Accor, visit https://careers.accor.com/

Do what you love, care for the world, dare to challenge the status quo! #BELIMITLESS

job_title: Operations Lead - Disability Management Solutions Services (DMSS) - TELUS Health
industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Telecommunications, and Utilities
description:
Description



Join our team


TELUS Health Virtual Care is the leading Canadian virtual care platform; we are reimagining how healthcare can look differently – benefiting both patients and providers. TELUS Health Virtual Care connects more than 2 million Canadians across the country to our team of kind and knowledgeable primary care providers; through our user-friendly app, our team of Registered Nurses, Nurse Practitioners, and Physicians can help patients get new and refill prescriptions, obtain specialist and lab referrals, and have their health questions answered - 24/7, across the country, in French and English. In addition, our team of Mental Health Therapists provide one-on-one private sessions as well as providing disability management services.

At the core of our mission is a passion to improve the health experience for patients and providers, leading to better health outcomes for everyone. We wake up every day with a single, simple question: “how can we help more people?” This question has united us more than ever during the COVID-19 pandemic, as we all rallied around this worthy cause.

Like the clinical service we deliver, our team culture values kindness, compassion, collaboration, and critical thinking. We’re a tight-knit, supportive team that is connected by our common mission to do good in the world and make a positive, impactful difference in Canadian healthcare.


Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


As a Disability Management Solutions Services (DMSS) Operations Lead, you will be responsible for the day-to-day operations of the offering, working with Sales and Product to develop the program roadmap and lead an exceptional team.

Reporting to the Director of Operations, you’ll be using data to drive insights, bringing fresh improvement ideas all to ensure we’re all moving in the same direction. Working with multiple stakeholders, you’ll be presented with a fast paced environment requiring constant organization while maintaining close attention to detail.



Here's How





Managing large scale cross-functional projects involving senior stakeholders to bring operational efficiencies to our DMSS operations

Manage a team of Program Coordinators as they provide exceptional experience to the Clients’ Case Managers and the Patients themselves

Represent the operations team on projects run by other departments

Determining operation strategies by conducting needs assessments, performance reviews, strategic planning, cost/benefit analysis, productivity, quality & customer service standards, and ensuring alignment with overall objectives

Maintaining and improving operations by monitoring system and service performance, identifying and resolving problems, completing action plans, completing service analyses, managing systems and process improvement, as well as quality assurance programs

Creating and preparing system and service performance reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing data and trends (e.g. response times, patient satisfaction ratings, abandon rates, cost to serve per member per month)

Introduce new policies, procedures, and training documentation commensurate with the size and scope of our growing business

Contribute to the design, implementation, and management of the DMSS program

Monitor service delivery and adherence to the care plans by maintaining client and therapist feedback

Aid in the completion of clinical questionnaires and note review, including all appropriate paperwork to comply with program policy and procedures

Contribute to a high-performing culture, focused on partnering with clients

Contributes to the content and design of the promotional material for all programs

Communicate with current clients on status of on-going programs and new potential opportunities

Ensure appropriate staffing of both Program Coordinator and clinician teams to meet client demand




Qualifications



Here’s what we need to complete our puzzle:




4-6 years of experience in operations or management consulting

Strong analytical skills

Large scale project management experience

Confident working with cross functional teams

A hands-on learner that can navigate ambiguity, complex issues and concepts

Strong problem-solving, decision-making, and multi-tasking skills

Grit and tenacity while maintaining a positive outlook

Prior experience managing a team, care management supervisory experience a strong asset

Outstanding communication skills – written and verbal




Nice to have:




Previous healthcare experience or knowledge of disability products and disability management process within insurance companies is an asset

Bilingual a strong asset

job_title: Executive Director and Chief of Staff, Office of the President
description:
Simon Fraser University (SFU) is Canada’s engaged university, defined by its dynamic integration of innovative education, cutting-edge research and far-reaching community engagement and impact. SFU is unconventional, fearless, compassionate, approachable, and ready. SFU aspires to represent the diversity of people, ideas, and cultures to the fullest of ways throughout our institution.




Our principles prioritize people and communities with a focus on academic and intellectual freedom, diversity, internationalization, respect for Indigenous peoples and cultures, a supportive and healthy work environment, and sustainability.




With campuses in British Columbia’s three largest cities—Vancouver, Burnaby, and Surrey—SFU has 2,500 staff and over 1,000 faculty that deliver world-class programs to approximately 37,000 undergraduate and graduate students. SFU has consistently been ranked as a top employer in Canada.




The Executive Director and Chief of Staff provides confidential, strategic and tactical advice, counsel and support to the President. As the chief executive advisor to the President, supports the President’s overarching leadership and representation of the entire SFU community. Oversees issues management for the President, participates with the President and other senior leaders in the University’s strategic planning process, and works with the Vice Presidents, General Counsel and University Secretary to foster effective operations and a collaborative effort of the executive team.

English Fluent (written and verbal)
